net.sourceforge.JDash.gui
Class GaugePanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.GaugePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GaugePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A simple extension to a JPanel. This simply draws the skin background in place. Like most JPanels, you can add swing components to it's main area. But, you MUST add a component with an original outter rectangle size value. do not just call add(comp). you MUST use add(comp, Rectangle);

See Also:
Serialized Form

paintShape

                          AbstractShape shape,
                          java.awt.Shape awtShape)
A utility method to the paintShapes() method when you only have one shape to paint, and dont' want to keep makeing an array list.

Parameters:
g2 -

awtShape -
scalingTransform -

paintShapes

protected void paintShapes(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                           AbstractShape shape,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> awtShapes)
Use this method to do the actual drawing of the awt shape. This method will do alot of the common attribute settings for a generated shape. The AbstractShape and shape genered from it often need to have color, line and text values set. This method will do that for you automatically. The shape is NOT recreated from the AbstractShape. And it is up you you to have already applied any transforms.

Parameters:
g2 - IN - the GC to draw to. This is a copy of the actual GC so there is it's parametrs should not requrre re-setting.
shape - IN - the shape that is being painted.
awtShape - IN - the array list of AWT shapes that will be rendered.

paintGlyphs

protected void paintGlyphs(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                           TextShape textShape,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           java.awt.font.GlyphVector glyphs)
This paint method acts like the paintShapes() method, except it's designed for text glyphs, rather than AWT shapes. s * @param g2 IN - the graphics context to draw to.s

Parameters:
textShape - IN - the text shape these glyphs represent. The color attibute is what is needed here.
x - IN - the x position to put the glyphs. They should have alrady been sized.
y - IN - the y position to put the glyphs, they should have already been sized.
glyphs - IN - the glyph vector to draw.

suspendGaugeDisplayUpdates

protected void suspendGaugeDisplayUpdates(boolean suspend)
call this method to suspend gauge updates. This is used primarily by the logg playback capability. In order to increase performance, this method is called to prevent screen re-draws. Once done, this method will re-enable the updates.

Parameters:
suspend -

isGaugeDisplayUpdateSuspended

public boolean isGaugeDisplayUpdateSuspended()
The AbstractGauge checks this value before propogating a redraw.

Returns:
